metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6532 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in Icinga 2.x through 2.8.1. By sending specially crafted (authenticated and unauthenticated) requests, an attacker can exhaust a lot of memory on the server side, triggering the OOM killer.

criterions.comment: icinga: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
